intro: Schoenoplectus lacustris f. laxiflorus, commonly known as the broad-flowered bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and large, showy inflorescences that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and blade-like, often forming dense clusters at the base. This subspecies is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats and plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils.
